revised_title: Architecture and Scientific Treatises: A Review of Two Books
tldr: The article reviews two books, one on architecture and the other on scientific treatises. The author discusses the principles and practice of architecture, the role of the Royal Academy of Architecture in Paris, and the importance of other sciences for architects. The second book reviews two treatises on fluid bodies and the Torricellian experiment, comparing them to works by Boyle and Wallis.
